entry.title: Re: How to validate mandatory attachment in Post General...
entry.content:
Hello @archana_raut38 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, there is no standard way to block posting if an attachment is missing in Post General Journal Entries or Verify General Journal Entries. SAP‚Äôs public KBA confirms this. SAP Support Portal-3643330 - Make attachment Mandatory in journal entries during posting in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Practical options

Use the verification workflow as a process control
Route entries via Verify General Journal Entries and instruct processors to reject any entries without supporting evidence. Although not an automatic hard stop, this is the approved governance process within Cloud.SAP Learning-Defining How to Hold and Verify General Journal Entries

Audit for missing attachments and follow up

Use the Attachment API to check if a posted journal has attached files by calling API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV/GetAttachmentCount or by using GetAllOriginals to list attachments. This allows a simple check, such as in SAP Build Process Automation/BTP, which can notify the requester via email or create a follow-up task when no files are present.  

Know the limits of BAdIs and validations

The Manage Substitution/Validation Rules app cannot validate ‚Äúhas attachment.‚Äù It works only in the JE context. SAP Help Portal-Manage Substitution/Validation Rules

The BAdI for Managing Journal Entries deals with attachment authorisation, not making attachments mandatory. SAP Help Portal-BAdI for Managing Journal Entries

 If this must be a hard block, log it with SAP
SAP‚Äôs KBA suggests submitting an influence request for a native ‚Äúattachment required‚Äù check when posting. SAP Support Portal-3643330 - Make attachment Mandatory in journal entries during posting in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Let me know if you need further assistance

With regards

Chuma

GenAI Assisted Content SAP Documentations.

BR Fabian

entry.title: Re: Adding calculated rows in SAP Analytics Cloud table f...
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I discovered why the 'new row' only displayed the formula cell references e.g. =A5-A6 or Sum (A5, A6). I arrived at this when I right clicked the desired dimension row labels to add a calculation by selecting add a client calculation option from the context menu.

To resolve this, I navigated to the top right corner of your table: More Actions denoted by 3 dots in a circle. Then scrolled to Show/Hide option and deselected/unticked Formulas ie. More Actions > Show/Hide> Untick Formulas

After following the above step, the formula values displayed as desired and I proceeded to rename the new row (dimension row label) from the default numerical operation name e.g. Sum or Subtract.

entry.title: Linux Shell Script for automating graceful startup and shutdown of SAP S4HANA System
entry.content:
Linux Shell Script for automating graceful startup and shutdown of SAP S4HANA [Only meant for Single Tier System] in SUSE Linux VMs/Instances inside cloud environment.

 

This post is purely focusing on the OS level scripting and is not associated with nor related with any of the cloud console level automation using serverless concepts, for example AWS Lambda.

 

Running SAP S4HANA on virtual machines in cloud environments like Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud comes with its unique challenges‚Äîespecially when it comes to starting and stopping services reliably and cost-effectively.

 

As most of us are familiar, when a VM or Instance boots up, post the OS booting process, it‚Äôs critical to start the SAP HANA database *before* the SAP application to avoid issues/failures. Similarly, during a VM shutdown, the SAP application must stop *before* the database to ensure all processes close gracefully, preventing data corruption or downtime.

 

Leaving SAP systems running idle can also cause unnecessary cloud billing, especially in PoC or Demo setups where uptime directly impacts costs.

 

To address the above mentioned two of the key issues, I developed simple yet effective shell scripts that automate the controlled start and stop sequence of SAP S4HANA based on the VM‚Äôs lifecycle. These scripts can be manually invoked or integrated into cloud startup/shutdown hooks, ensuring SAP services respond correctly whenever the OS boots or halts.

 

This automation enhances reliability and saves effort and rework by enabling the graceful shutting down of SAP S4HANA App and DB.

 

Here‚Äôs how it works:

To achieve the above-mentioned automation, you need to follow the steps mentioned below

 

  1.       Logon with root user on the VM/instance where SAP DB & Application is hosted.
  2.       Gain the clean root environment with default variables and path using the command: sudo su -
  3.       Navigate to the path: /etc/systemd/system/
  4.       vi sap-s4hana.service
  5.       enter the following contents in this file.

Note: Please refer to the path used in this file content, you need to use same or in case you want to change the path or file naming convention etc., you may document the changes accordingly.

 

[Unit]

Description=SAP S/4HANA single-tier startup/shutdown orchestrator (HANA + App)

After=network.target

 

[Service]

Type=oneshot

ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/sap-start.sh

ExecStop=/usr/local/bin/sap-stop.sh

RemainAfterExit=yes

TimeoutStartSec=1800

TimeoutStopSec=1800

 

[Install]

WantedBy=multi-user.target

 

  1.       save the file
  2.       Update the permissions of this file: chmod +x sap-s4hana.service
  3.       Update file ownership of this file: chown root:root sap-s4hana.service
  4.       For creating the shell script for starting the SAP S4HANA DB and SAP S4 Application, Navigate to the path:

/usr/local/bin

vi sap-start.sh

  1. 10.  enter the following contents in this file:

Note: Please refer to the path used in this file content, you need to use same or in case you want to change the path or naming convention, you may document the changes accordingly.

Ensure to update the relevant user id, SAP SID, Instance Numbers in this content,

 

#!/bin/bash

LOGFILE="/var/log/sap-start.log"

exec >> "$LOGFILE" 2>&1

echo "===== [$(date)] Starting SAP S/4HANA DB ====="

# Start HANA DB

sudo -u xxxadm /usr/sap/XXX/HDB02/HDB start

echo "HANA DB start command executed."

# Wait for DB

sudo -u xxxadm /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 02 -function WaitforStarted 600

echo "HANA DB started successfully."

echo "===== [$(date)] Starting SAP Application ====="

# Start SAP App

sudo -u xxxadm /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 00 -function StartSystem

echo "SAP Application start command executed."

# Wait for SAP App

sudo -u xxxadm /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 00 -function WaitforStarted 300

echo "SAP Application started successfully."

echo "===== [$(date)] SAP System Startup Completed ====="

  1. 11.  save the file
  2. 12.  Update the permissions of this file: chmod 777 sap-start.sh
  3. 13.  Update the ownership of this file: chown root:root sap-start.sh

 

 

 

  1. 14.  For creating the shell script for stopping the SAP S4 Application & SAP S4HANA DB, continue in same folder, and follow the steps below:

/usr/local/bin

vi sap-stop.sh

  1.   #!/bin/bash
  2.   LOGFILE="/var/log/sap-stop.log‚Äù
  3. 17.  exec >> "$LOGFILE" 2>&1
  4. 18.  echo "===== [$(date)] Stopping SAP Application ====="
  5.   # Stop SAP App
  6. 20.  sudo -u xxxadm /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 00 -function StopSystem
  7. 21.  echo "SAP Application stop command executed."
  8.   # Wait for SAP App
  9. 23.  sudo -u xxxadm /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 00 -function WaitforStopped 300
  10.   echo "SAP Application stopped successfully."
  11. 25.  echo "===== [$(date)] Stopping HANA DB ====="
  12.   # Stop HANA DB
  13.   sudo -u xxxadm /usr/sap/XXX/HDB02/HDB stop
  14. 28.  echo "HANA DB stop command executed."
  15.   # Wait for DB
  16. 30.  sudo -u xxxadm /usr/sap/hostctrl/exe/sapcontrol -nr 02 -function WaitforStopped 600
  17. 31.  echo "HANA DB stopped successfully."
  18. 32.  echo "===== [$(date)] SAP System Shutdown Completed ====="
  19. 33.  save the file
  20. 34.  Update the permissions of this file: chmod 777 sap-stop.sh
  21. 35.  Update the ownership of this file: chown root:root sap-stop.sh
  22.   During your copying of the above-mentioned commands and scripts in the linux host, quite often the files might get appended with carriage returns (^M , \r ), this can be concluded during checking of the above created files using the cat command, if fould, you can use one of the following command to clean for each of the three files created above :

sudo dos2unix filename                                [or]

sudo sed -I ‚Äòs/\r$//‚Äô filename

  1. 37.  Further to the completion of above steps, navigate to the path /etc/systemd/system

sudo systemctl daemon-reload

sudo systemctl enable sap-s4hana.service

  1. 38.  If you have not started the SAP S4HANA DB and S4 Application, you can proceed to execute

sudo systemctl start sap-s4hana.service

By executing this command, you must check the progress of DB status and Application status using the sapcontrol command

  1. 39.  Post checking the proper starting of the SAP S4HANA DB and S4 Application, you can also check the proper stopping by executing the following command

sudo systemctl stop sap-s4hana.service

By executing this command, you must check the progress of DB status and Application status using the sapcontrol command

  

Why This Matters

- Protects SAP data integrity with clean startups and shutdowns  

- Saves cloud costs, ideal for PoC / Demo / Dev environments  

- Makes manual intervention unnecessary, cutting operational overhead

entry.title: Re: Analysis for Office ‚Äì Planning data not saved after s...
entry.content:
Hello @Francesco_Allocca1 ,

Did you find an answer to this problem? Which AfO version are you using? I have the same problem (or a similar one?) with 2.8 2402 1853.

The user cannot copy values in the crosstab and click save - this won't save anything.

Here is a workaround, maybe it helps others:

The user needs to copy the first row, validate all characteristic copied and one key figure (press F2 and Enter on each of these cells for the first line). The Save button in the Analysis ribbon will then activate. After that she can copy the rest (several rows and columns) and save all values, this suddenly starts working.

Best regards,

St√©phane

entry.title: Material Purchase Text Not Printed for Subcontracting Items
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently facing an issue related to purchase order printing and would appreciate any insights:

For standard purchase order items, the material purchase text is printed correctly, as expected.

However, the behavior changes when it comes to subcontracting items (item category L):

  • The material purchase text is not determined for the main material of the subcontracting item.
  • Instead, the texts for the components are retrieved and printed; which is not desired in our case.

I've already analyzed the behavior and explored potential enhancement options. The only possibly relevant point I found was the BAdI MMPUR_PO_STD_ITEM_TEXT. However, at that point in time, all relevant input variables appear to be empty, so it doesn't seem helpful for this use case.

Unfortunately, my research (OSS Notes, forums, blogs) hasn't led to a solution.

My question to the community: Has anyone encountered a similar issue or found a workaround/enhancement spot that allows the material purchase text to be included for subcontracting items in the PO output?

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

Best regards,

Manuela

entry.title: Re: Sending emails from SAC
entry.content:
@ilsevg1 

May be something like below. Update the receiver User ID. Refer to the blog below, it has a section on email.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/how-to-schedule-an-analytic-application-for-publication-in-sap-analytics/ba-p/13488040

 

var notificationTitle = "Test Email Notification";
   var notificationContent = NotificationHelper.GenerateNotificationContent();
    
   Application.sendNotification({
         title: notificationTitle,
         content: notificationContent,
         isSendEmail: true,
         mode: ApplicationMode.Present,
         receivers: ["SACUSERID"]
    });

  Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: SAP Hana DB Triggers
entry.content:
Hello gurus, 

Does the .hdbtrigger provide details of what has been changed? And if yes how to access this?

Below is my trigger, and I want the "CONTEXT" to contain info on what has been changed

 
TRIGGER "TR_TB_COSTCENTERTEXT_CREATE"
  AFTER INSERT ON "TB_COSTCENTERTEXT"
  REFERENCING NEW ROW NewRow
  FOR EACH ROW
  BEGIN
   
    INSERT INTO TB_CHANGELOG
    (
      "ID",
      "SOURCETABLE",
      "SOURCE",
      "ACTION",
      "LOGTIME",
      "CONTEXT",
      "STATUS")
      VALUES
      (
        SYSUUID,
        'TB_COSTCENTERTEXT',
        :NewRow."source",
        'INSERT',
        NOW(),
        ---> <what was changed> <----,
        'NEW'
      );
  END;
 
Update: 
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/using-hana-database-triggers-to-capture-selected-column-updates/ba-p/13159575
I found this approach using "REFERENCING OLD ROW OldRow, NEW ROW NewRow" and then compare the columns 1 by 1.. But that is quit a big task when you have many columns to track.
Any smarter solution available?

entry.title: Re: Task Templates Now Work Everywhere!
entry.content:
Thank you for this really useful new feature in CALM. Creating Objects from everywhere was really needed.

Question to the Community, i hope i can find the answer here.

I'm facing a strange issue in SAP Cloud ALM related to requirement templates.
We created a requirement and marked it as a template so that future requirements could be based on it. Later, we created a new template and deleted the old one via the Tasks app (filtered by "Template = Yes"). The old template is no longer visible in the Tasks app, and there are no obsolete or inactive tasks left.

However, when creating a new requirement, the system still shows two templates to choose from ‚Äî even though the old one was deleted. This is causing confusion among users, as they can't tell which template is the correct one.

Interestingly, I tried to reproduce the issue in a separate Cloud ALM test system, and there everything works as expected: once a template is deleted, it no longer appears in the selection list.

Is there any way to check if the old template is still referenced somewhere or cached in the system? Or is this a known issue?

Any help or insights would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,
S.M.

entry.title: Step-by-Step Guide: Enabling Standard F4 Help for Custom Field created using SAP CFL App
entry.content:
Overview: In SAP, CFL refers to Custom Fields and Logic. It is not a standalone application; rather, it is a Fiori application provided by SAP as a component of S/4HANA Extensibility. The application allows users to incorporate new fields and business logic into standard SAP applications without coding. In this section, we will locate the Custom Fields and Custom Logic tab. Within the Custom Fields tab, we can add our custom fields, while the Custom Logic tab is designated for BAdI implementation, which is currently not in use. For custom logic, we have an additional Fiori application named as Custom Logic.

Introduction: In this blog, we will explore how to add a custom field using the Custom Fields and Logic Fiori application, as well as how to implement standard search help (F4 Help) within that custom field using the SAP Screen Layout of custom created Sub-screen or Main Screen.

Step-by-Step Process:

Step 1 - Open Custom Fields and logic Fiori App.

Step 2 - Press the ‚Äú+‚Äù button located at the top right.

Step 3 - After clicking the ‚Äú+‚Äù button, a pop-up will appear prompting you to enter the appropriate Business Context Id (MM_PURREQN_ITEM) for the corresponding SAP module along with any other necessary fields.

Step 4 - Please choose the correct type from the dropdown menu (such as Text, Code List, etc.). The Text option is solely for input purposes, while the Code List should be used if you wish to assign any fixed values to your field, as other types serve different functions.

Step 5 - Give desired length to the field and click on ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù Button.

Step 6 - It will appear like this on ‚ÄúHome Page‚Äù of the App.

Step 7 - Provide the field label to the field and click on ‚ÄúSave‚Äù and ‚ÄúPublish‚Äù Button.

Step 8 - In the other tabs, you will find the UI specifications, names of CDS Views, details of the Odata Service, API information, and more.

Step 9 - Once you publish your field, it will be incorporated into the standard table of the relevant business context. In my situation, it will appear in the EBAN table with a name that begins with "ZZ1" under an Append Structure.

Step 10 - Custom sub-screen as a Customer Data tab has been created in the ME51N T-code (Create Purchase Requisition Fiori App) where I have added that custom field.

Step 11 - Open the Screen Layout of the corresponding screen via path System > status > Program Name > Screen > Screen Layout.

Step 12 - Double click on the input field and Properties pop-up will appear.

Step 13 - Enter the standard search help name in the search help field of the property pop-up, and you will notice the F4 help added in the custom field.

Step 14 - Search Help Window.

Conclusion: Using the Custom Fields and Logic app in SAP Fiori, we can easily extend standard applications like ME51N by creating custom fields tailored to business needs. By integrating standard search helps into these fields and placing them on a custom sub screen, we enhance usability while maintaining consistency with SAP‚Äôs native behavior. This approach ensures flexibility, upgrade safety, and a smooth user experience‚Äîall without needing deep technical development.

This approach will work when you have custom screen, for standard screen we have an alternative option to utilize CDS views F4 help during the creation of fields via Custom fields and logic Fiori App.

entry.title: How to add account assignment columns to PR item table in My Inbox (Public Cloud)?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I‚Äôm working in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition and have a question regarding the "My Inbox" app for the overall release of Purchase Requisitions (PR).

Currently, when I open a PR approval task in My Inbox, the item details are shown in a table inside the task UI. This table displays standard columns like material, quantity, price, etc.

My requirement:
I need to add additional columns to this table for account assignment data‚Äîspecifically:

  • GL account
  • Cost center
  • WBS element

The goal is to show these fields directly in the item table, so approvers don‚Äôt have to drill down into each item‚Äôs detail screen.

Questions:

  1. Is there any supported way in Public Cloud to enhance the columns of the item table in the My Inbox task UI?
  2. Can this be achieved via Custom Fields and Logic, or any BAdI/CDS extension?
  3. If not possible, what are the recommended alternatives?

Any guidance, documentation, or best practices would be greatly appreciated.

Kind Regards,
Simon

entry.title: Re: How to deal with the inconsistency between the unit o...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

Here's information that might be helpful:

Batch-Specific Material Units of Measure

Batch-Specific Units of Measure

Conversion Factor from Two Units of Measure

You can batch-specific units of measure:

  1. Use proportion units or product units to define alternative units of measure for the material.
  2. In the material master record, set the planned conversion factor for the material. Once the batch is known, update the actual conversion factor in the batch master record.
  3. When entering data, use the function to calculate the conversion factor from base units of measure.
  4. if necessary, you can manually enter the sample size in the desired unit, ensuring it aligns with the batch-specific unit of measure.

Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Re: Singapore TAX Invoice ---GST number in public cloud e...
entry.content:
To maintain GST number and address correctly:

  • Define Business Place: Use SSCUI or CBC (Central Business Configuration) to define business places for each GST registration.
  • Assign Business Place to Plant: This links the plant to the correct GST registration.
  • Maintain Tax Numbers: In the Business Place configuration, enter the GST number under ‚ÄúTax Number 1‚Äù.
  • Maintain Address: The address in the Business Place will be used in invoice outputs. If needed, you can extend the form template to pull the plant address using a BADI.

entry.title: Re: S4HANA Cloud - form title doesn't show in page 3 and...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

Here's information that might help you:

Maintain Form Templates

Can you please check the following:

  1. Check Page Count Logic: Ensure that the pageCount variable is correctly capturing the total number of pages. You might want to add debugging statements to verify the value of pageCount.

  2. Verify Page References: Double-check that the references to mst1 and mst2 are correct and that these pages are properly defined in your master form template.

  3. Script Execution: Ensure that the script is executing at the right time. Sometimes, scripts may not run as expected due to timing issues in the form‚Äôs lifecycle.

  4. Master Form Template: Confirm that the master form template is correctly set up to handle multiple pages. The template should Manage Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Master Form Templates have definitions for both mst1 and mst2 pages.

  5. Form Title Binding: Verify that the form_title variable is correctly populated and bound to the text field in the header.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: WBS element assigned to GR/IR account in invoice but...
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition allows posting to balance sheet G/L accounts with real WBS elements, even if the account is not a cost element. This is a departure from ECC, where you needed to assign a statistical cost element category like 90, to enable such postings.

During Goods Receipt, the system posts to inventory or expense accounts, typically class 6 or 7, and the WBS element is populated only if the account is a cost element. During Invoice Receipt (IR), the system posts to the GR/IR clearing account, which is a balance sheet account. In S/4HANA Cloud, this account can accept a WBS element even without being a cost element.

Since both GR and IR are debit postings but only IR carries the WBS element, reports based on WBS may show incomplete or misleading cost allocations.

Explore the below options

If you want consistent reporting, consider using statistical WBS elements for GR/IR accounts. In ECC, this was done via cost element category ‚Äú90‚Äù. In S/4HANA Cloud, use the ‚ÄúRecord account assignment‚Äù checkbox in the G/L master record to allow WBS tagging on balance sheet accounts.

Create a custom CDS view or report that links GR and IR postings and normalizes WBS assignment across both. This is especially useful if you rely on WBS for project cost tracking and reconciliation.

Ensure that the WBS element is consistently assigned across PO, GR, and IR. If using external systems like Concur, ensure they pass back correct WBS references

entry.title: Streamlining Access Governance or Crave Infotech and SAP Session Overview
entry.content:
Why it is important to streamline Access Governance?

SAP ERP is a comprehensive system for managing various business processes. Integrating it with other non-SAP systems can yield significant benefits, such as enhanced user experience,  and access to specialized features. This integration creates a more robust and flexible IT landscape, which better supports complex and dynamic business needs by leveraging the strengths of multiple systems.

However, the benefits of a flexible IT landscape require stringent security controls across all systems. It's crucial to conduct detailed risk analyses and implement segregation of duties for roles and authorizations in both SAP and non-SAP systems. This prevents unauthorized access and potential fraud, ensuring that no single individual can complete critical processes or transactions without oversight. This approach helps mitigate risks like unauthorized data modification, financial misstatements, and operational disruptions, ultimately helping enhance overall organizational security and compliance.

What are the possible use cases and benefits for our customers:

1. Identity Management systems

Use Case:

  • Identity Management and Governance: Identity management systems help manage user identities, access rights, and compliance across multiple systems, including SAP ERP. It provides a centralized view for identity governance and ensures that only authorized users have access to critical business data.

Value:

  • Enhanced security by managing and governing identities.
  • Help with regulatory requirements like GDPR, SOX, etc.
  • Streamlined access management processes, reducing manual errors and increasing efficiency.

2. IT Service Management

Use Case:

  • IT Service Request and Incident Management: Service Management can handle IT service requests, incidents, and changes, integrating with SAP ERP for tasks like asset management, purchasing, and financial tracking.
  • Automation Workflows: Automates IT processes that may not be covered by SAP, such as incident management workflows.

Value:

  • Improved IT service delivery and efficiency.
  • Enhanced visibility and control over IT operations.
  • Better integration of IT processes with business processes managed in SAP.

3. Other ERP Systems

Use Case:

  • Subsidiaries or Specific Departments: Some businesses may use different ERP systems for specific departments, subsidiaries, or geographic regions. This can be due to historical reasons, specialization, or specific functional requirements.
  • Integration and Data Exchange: Using middleware and integration platforms to sync data between multiple ERP systems.

Value:

  • Flexibility in meeting diverse business needs.
  • Ability to leverage best-of-breed solutions for specific areas.

4. Non-SAP HR Systems

Use Case:

  • Specialized HR Functions: integration with non-SAP HR for event management process. Authorization are in place when changes are needed from HR perspective.
  • Integration for Employee Data: Syncing HR data with centralized authorization process.

Value:

  • Enhanced HR capabilities and user experiences.
  • Better alignment of HR information with user authorizations.

With the value of integration now clear, let's delve deeper into the insights from our webinar, 'Simplifying SAP GRC Access Governance Deployments: Extending IAG Standard and Bridge Edition to Cover the Enterprise'.

Date: September 17, 2025

Key Speakers:

  • Swetta Singh, Chief Product Expert, Product Management at SAP Governance, Risk & Compliance
  • Vishal Verma, Global Vice President - AccessHub, Crave Infotech


Session Content

Swetta Singh (SAP)

  1. Overview of Identity and Access Governance Solutions: Swetta provided a comprehensive overview of SAP's identity and access governance solutions, highlighting their capabilities and benefits.
  2. Differences Between Standard and Integration Editions: She explained the distinctions between the standard and integration editions of SAP IAG. This included features, functionalities, and scenarios where each is most beneficial.
  3. Hybrid Landscape: Swetta discussed the implications and differences in moving towards a hybrid landscape. This involved detailing how SAP's solutions can be effectively deployed and managed in both cloud and on-premise environments.

Vishal Verma (Crave Infotech)

  1. Extending SAP Access Governance Solutions to Non-SAP Apps: Vishal introduced four scenarios for extending SAP access governance solutions to non-SAP applications. These scenarios illustrate different integration strategies and use cases.

Four Access Governance Scenarios

  1. Enterprise-wide Access Governance with SAP IAG
    • Description: Extending SAP's landscape to other applications where AccessHub provides integration and content. This includes seamlessly integrating non-SAP applications into the existing SAP IAG framework for consistent governance.
  2. Enterprise-wide Access Governance with SAP Access Control
    • Description: AccessHub integrates with SAP Access Control solutions to enable comprehensive governance. This scenario ensures that all access requests and compliance checks are managed centrally through SAP Access Control.
  3. Automate HR-Driven Access Across SAP & Enterprise Apps
    • Description: AccessHub integrates with HR applications to automate access requests based on HR processes and changes. This includes scenarios where employee access is automatically updated based on HR records.
  4. Embed Access Governance into Workflows
    • Description: Third-party tools perform the role of a ServiceDesk, and AccessHub connects these tools with provisioning systems like SAP IAG. This integration allows access governance functions to be directly embedded within ServiceDesk workflows.

Conclusion

Vishal concluded the session by highlighting a success story:

  • 70% Reduction in Provisioning Time: At a large utility company, Crave connected Access Hub with SAP Access Control solutions to achieve significant improvements in provisioning time. This setup enabled cross-system risk analysis, streamlined access requests, efficient user access reviews, and robust audit reporting.

Summary

The webinar emphasized the benefits of extending SAP's access governance solutions to non-SAP applications. Real-world success stories were presented to underscore the critical role of seamless integration in delivering comprehensive access governance across the enterprise landscape. The session highlighted the significant improvements in efficiency, compliance, and overall security provided by these integrations.

Follow-Up

If you are interested in reviewing the session, follow these links to access the slides and recording:

  • Slides
  • Recording

entry.title: How to Efficiently Delete Duplicate Items in Outlook?
entry.content:
Initially, my mailbox had multiple copies of the same emails, contacts, and calendar entries, and manually removing them was taking forever. Is there an easier or automated way to do this? But I later found the solution & I want to share it with you all.

Manually deleting duplicates in Outlook can be time-consuming and prone to mistakes, especially if you have a large mailbox. The most efficient way is to use a dedicated tool like SysTools Outlook Duplicate Remover. It automatically scans your PST or OST files and removes duplicates from emails, contacts, calendars, tasks, notes, and journals. You can choose to find duplicates within folders or across multiple folders and apply filters like date, subject, or sender for precision.

It made my work easy; if you also want, then you can use it by clicking on the above link. Thank me later.

entry.title: Re: IF_EX_ME_PROCESS_REQ_CUST~PROCESS_ITEM NOT getting up...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

The following information might be helpful:

  • Check Buffering: Verify if the EBAN table is buffered and consider flushing the buffer or using SELECT ... FOR UPDATE to ensure you are reading the latest data.
  • Commit Work: Ensure that you call BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT after your BAPI call to commit the changes.
  • Debugging: Use the SAP debugger to step through the transaction ME52N and check where the loekz field is being set or modified.
  • Review Enhancements: Check for any custom enhancements or user exits that might affect the display of the loekz field in ME52N

 

Kind regards, Henrike

get notification from work order ( use AFIH table) & call update notification BAPI'S & populated Reported by in header str.

entry.title: Embrace Innovation and Transformation at the SAP ALM Summit EMEA 2025 in Darmstadt, Germany!
entry.content:
The SAP ALM Summit EMEA 2025 is set to take place in the vibrant city of Darmstadt, Germany, from October 20th to 23rd. Expect this year's summit to be a highly focused event with new session formats, shorter event duration and an all-new location designed to engage and inspire our attendees.

The summit will be held at the darmstadtium congress center, a unique venue in Darmstadt, Germany, that combines science and architecture in a remarkable way. Fun Fact: The science and congress centre takes its name from the element darmstadtium (Ds, 110), which was discovered at the GSI Helmholtz Centre for Heavy Ion Research in Darmstadt in 1994. The eco-friendly venue is easily accessible by public transportation, with the main railway station and city center just a short walk away. With its modern architecture and advanced technology, it provides the perfect setting for insightful learning and networking opportunities.

Congress center - darmstadtium

The event will kick off with a pre-opening welcome reception on Monday, October 20th, where attendees get the chance to pick up their badge early and avoid the queue on Tuesday morning. It is the perfect opportunity to network already with colleagues, SAP experts, and the ALM family & friends in a relaxed atmosphere, while enjoying delicious beverages and finger food.

The agenda for the summit has been completely renewed, with each day featuring a different keynote focused on the ALM strategy, innovation and adoption. Moreover, the summit will feature a Guest Keynote and five Partner Keynotes, followed by two Expert Panels, offering insights from industry leaders and SAP experts.

Running parallel to the keynote sessions, attendees can visit the SAP Booth, where SAP Cloud ALM Clinics will be available all three days, providing attendees with the opportunity to engage with experts and gain hands-on experience with SAP's ALM tools. In total, the SAP Demo Booth will host 16 demo sessions, covering a wide range of topics such as Interface Management, AI-driven scenarios in SAP Cloud ALM, Risk Management, Clean Core compliance, regulated environments, and the SAP Readiness Check for SAP Cloud ALM. Attendees can also explore analytics monitoring dashboards powered by SAP Joule and learn about the importance of clean core and clean data for business growth.

For those interested in the SAP Integrated Toolchain, the exclusive Integrated Toolchain Demo Booth will showcase 24 demos focusing on SAP LeanIX, SAP Signavio, and SAP Cloud ALM, where attendees can gain a deeper understanding of how these tools work together and how to streamline and optimize their ALM processes.

 Agenda of Day 1

The ALM Summit EMEA offers also an exciting opportunity for attendees to gain hands-on experience with SAP Cloud ALM functionalities through six dedicated sessions. These sessions, led by subject matter experts, will guide participants through various tasks using their own devices, providing a more immersive and practical learning experience. The hands-on sessions will be held on the first and second days of the event and cover a range of topics, including migrating content from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM, building a proof-of-concept for manual testing, navigating transformations with the integrated toolchain and more. However, it is essential to note that attendees must register for these sessions via the event app, and there are limited seats available for each session. To ensure a spot in the desired hands-on sessions, attendees are encouraged to check the agenda in the event app and register themselves as soon as possible. Please follow the link to the event app.

Additionally, a Usability Test Station will be open throughout the event, allowing participants to influence the future of SAP Cloud ALM through hands-on feedback on three entirely new functionalities such as: the Customisable Dashboard Builder powered by SAP Joule, the Project Quality Dashboard and key aspects of the Application Lifecycle Management like object versioning in SAP Cloud ALM. If attendees are interested in participating, there is a registration process that has to be fulfilled to join these sessions. For more details, please refer to this document.

Interactive Influencing sessions with Design Thinking will be another exciting component of the summit. These sessions will cover topics like shaping the future of libraries in SAP Cloud ALM, co-creating checks with AI for compliance, designing the perfect SAP Cloud ALM "good morning" page, reimagining the lifecycle through ideation, and exploring the transition from application performance monitoring to application performance management.

Attendees who are looking to advance their skills and knowledge, will also have the chance to obtain or renew their Solution Transformation Consultant Badge by participating in one of the three badge test options available.

This year, the 5th ALM-athon hackathon will be a highlight of the summit, showcasing the groundbreaking ideas and solutions developed by the participating teams. The expert jury has already selected the three finalists who will battle for the win. On October 22, these top 3 teams will take the stage in Darmstadt and present their scenarios in exciting live pitches. Attendees will have the opportunity to vote for their favourite solution and crown the winners of the ALM-athon 2025.

The ALM-athon finalists of 2024

With over 170 sessions covering various aspects of Application Lifecycle Management,  the SAP ALM Summit EMEA 2025 promises to be an immersive and transformative experience for all attendees.

Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to be part of the future of SAP Application Lifecycle Management. Join us in Darmstadt, where tradition and innovation come together to shape the future of SAP ALM. Register now for the SAP ALM Summit EMEA 2025 and be part of the transformation!

entry.title: Composable Storefront price and stock update in SAP Commerce Cloud
entry.content:
Introduction

In B2C market, performance is essential to drive immediate sales and quick conversions. And this aspect becomes more important during sold period as Black Friday. 

To meet performance expectations and to provide smooth experience, we often set in cache the whole product catalog through CDN/SSR strategy. And in other hand, we would like to have some flexible to update price and stock more frequently than the long TTL (Time To Live) defined on product detail data.

This article explains how we can decouple product detail information provided by SSR and price/stock information. 

 

Architecture

Anonymous PDP (Product Detail Page) content is provided by SSR and it can be set for the full day in CDN caching.

CSR hydration execute OCC API price/stock query at each page refresh. 

OCC API price/stock can be set in CDN caching too with shorter TTL.

 

Implementation

This implementation explanation is focused on PDP. But the principle can be reduced to apply this strategy on other pages/components.

First step is to create a new module to override default ProductSummaryComponent

@NgModule({
  providers: [
    provideDefaultConfig(<CmsConfig>{
      cmsComponents: {
        ProductSummaryComponent: {
          component: CsrProductPriceComponent,
        },
      },
    })
  ],
  declarations: [CsrProductPriceComponent],
  exports: [CsrProductPriceComponent],
  imports: [
    CommonModule,
    OutletModule,
    I18nModule,
    PromotionsModule,
    FeaturesConfigModule
  ],
})

export class CsrProductPriceModule { }

Then we need to create new component that will replace ProductSummaryComponent

@Component({
  selector: 'app-csr-product-price',
  standalone: false,
  templateUrl: './csr-product-price.component.html',
  changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush,
  styleUrl: './csr-product-price.component.scss'
})
export class CsrProductPriceComponent {
  outlets = ProductDetailOutlets;
  private platformId = inject(PLATFORM_ID);

  product$: Observable<Product | null>;

  protected getProduct(): Observable<Product | null> {
    const ssrProductScopes = [
      ProductScope.DETAILS,
      ProductScope.PRICE,
      ProductScope.PROMOTIONS,
    ];
    // https://angular.dev/api/common/isPlatformBrowser
    // CSR only fetch price/stock data and ignore SSR state
    if (isPlatformBrowser(this.platformId)) {
      return this.customProductService.getProductPrice();
    }
    return this.customProductService.getProduct(ssrProductScopes);
  }

  constructor(protected customProductService: CustomProductService) {
    this.product$ = this.getProduct();
  }
}

In this component, we need to create a custom product service for fetching only price/stock data and ignore SSR state. As you can see, we need to distinct during component evaluation CSR and SSR execution (isPlatformBrowser). In SSR, we're executing default behaviour that will fetch product detail where in CSR we will hydrate SSR output with new fresh price and stock information.

Custom product service inherits from CurrentProductService

@Injectable({
  providedIn: 'root',
})
export class CustomProductService extends CurrentProductService {

  constructor(
    private store: Store<StateWithProduct>,
    private pS: ProductService,
    routingService: RoutingService,
    productService: ProductService
  ) {
    super(routingService, productService);
  }

  getProductPrice(): Observable<Product | null> {
    // clear product price state provided by SSR
    this.store.dispatch(new ProductActions.ClearProductPrice());
    return this.getCode().pipe(
      distinctUntilChanged(),
      switchMap((productCode: string) => {
        return productCode
          ? 
          this.pS.get(
              productCode,
              ProductScope.PRICE
            )
          : of(null);
      }),
      filter(isNotUndefined)
    );
  }
}

When product price/stock is fetched, we clear SSR state on price information by executing a product action on NgRx store. By doing so, we force produce service to execute OCC API backend call instead of getting information from application state.

Note that default OCC API parameter can be influenced with Product Scope setting to reduce as much as possible the payload

endpoints: {
   product: {
    price: 'products/${productCode}?fields=price(formattedValue,DEFAULT),stock(DEFAULT)'
  }
}

Last step is to add new module in application startup

@NgModule({
  declarations: [
    AppComponent
  ],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule,
    StoreModule.forRoot({}),
    AppRoutingModule,
    EffectsModule.forRoot([]),
    SpartacusModule,
    CsrProductPriceModule
  ],
  providers: [provideHttpClient(withFetch(), withInterceptorsFromDi()), provideClientHydration(withEventReplay(), withNoHttpTransferCache())],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent]
})
export class AppModule { }

 

Testing

After those adjustment, you can test the new behaviour by starting SSR in local (check the right command in package.json)

npm build
npm run serve:ssr

In local, for testing purpose, you could need to disable TLS verification (server.ts)

function run() {
  const port = process.env['PORT'] || 4000;
  // disable TLS verifcation
  process.env['NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED'] = '0';
  ...

When you load a PDP page, for example http://localhost:4000/electronics-spa/en/USD/product/300938

You should have this following network activities

https://localhost:9002/occ/v2/electronics-spa/cms/pages?pageType=ProductPage&code=300938
https://localhost:9002/occ/v2/electronics-spa/products/300938/references
https://localhost:9002/occ/v2/electronics-spa/products/300938?fields=price(formattedValue,DEFAULT),stock(DEFAULT)

Last HTTP call confirms that price/stock data has been refreshed during CSR hydration.

 

Conclusion

SSR/CSR optimisation can be a game changer for your business. As we seen small adjustment could be performed quickly and  easily to fit your business expectations.

If you need more support, please don't hesitate to contact SAP Expert Services.

entry.title: Avoid accounting document while moving the stock from customer return stock
entry.content:
Currently, when customer returns are received, the stock is classified as customer stock. When we transfer the goods to unrestricted stock, it becomes our company‚Äôs stock. From there, we can proceed to scrap the goods if required.

In this process, the system generates two accounting documents:

When the stock is moved from customer (return) stock to unrestricted stock.

When the stock is moved from unrestricted stock to scrap.

We would like to know if there is any possibility to suppress the first accounting document (i.e., during the movement from customer return stock to unrestricted stock).

Can we get any SAP notes/ KBA, to get their confirmation on whether this is technically feasible or if it‚Äôs a standard system behavior that cannot be bypassed?

entry.title: Introducing the SAP Fiori Development Portal: Your Gateway to Rapid SAP Fiori App Creation (1 of 6)
entry.content:
Welcome to the first post in our mini-series exploring the SAP Fiori development portal - a new hub designed to empower every member of your project team to decide efficiently and collaboratively on the SAP Fiori app you want to add to your portfolio.

Before we demonstrate how you can explore and use the SAP Fiori development portal, this first post sets you up on what SAP Fiori elements for OData V4 really is, why it has become the UI framework of choice for SAP Fiori app development, and how our building block approach is changing the game for developers, designers, and business experts alike.

Why SAP Fiori Elements?

SAP Fiori elements for OData V4 is more than just a UI framework - it‚Äôs a metadata-driven approach that leverages the SAP Design System as its guiding principle. By listening to input from partners, customers, and SAP product teams, we ensure that the most relevant design system options are available in the framework at runtime. This means you can create applications that are not only consistent and enterprise-ready but also tailored to your unique requirements.

Whenever you create a SAP Fiori elements app, you automatically get the SAP Fiori design. SAP Fiori is the design concept framework for SAP applications, setting the standard for harmonized, user-centric experiences across the enterprise. SAP Fiori elements for OData V4 is the key enabler to implement and consume this harmonized experience, providing you with options to use standard floorplans for recurring layouts or building blocks for creative, custom layouts. In both cases, you can always extend further with freestyle SAPUI5 to address unique requirements and add custom features.

 Building Blocks: The Foundation of Flexibility

Over the past few years, we‚Äôve worked hard to break down SAP Fiori elements into a set of reusable building blocks. These building blocks - such as tables, forms, filter bars, and charts - are orchestrated by SAP Fiori elements and form the basis of every OData V4 application. They provide standardized layouts and interaction patterns, ensuring UI consistency and boosting developer productivity. For SAP Fiori elements for OData V4, we set up the building blocks as our center of gravity.

When you select a classic SAP Fiori elements floorplan, you‚Äôre choosing a predefined combination of these building blocks, optimized for standard use cases. This is the ultimate developer productivity solution. But if your project requires something different, you can use the same building blocks to create custom layouts, combining them as needed for maximum creativity and flexibility - all while retaining the benefits of an annotation-driven UI.

 

 

Two Paths, One Powerful Framework

Whether you choose a standard floorplan or a custom layout, you benefit from all the work we‚Äôve put into these building blocks: rapid app creation, consistent UI, and enterprise-ready features like personalization, key user support, and internationalization.

 

The SAP Fiori development portal: Your One-Stop Shop

To help you choose the right path for your project, we‚Äôre introducing the SAP Fiori development portal where you can explore options, collaborate, and make informed decisions at every step. This portal aims to provide all project team members‚Äîbusiness analysts, designers, developers, and users - with the information and tools they need to define a joint target picture and efficiently build SAP Fiori apps based on SAP Fiori elements for OData V4. Once the target picture of the SAP Fiori app is clear, you can easily create the app by using SAP Fiori tools.

Endless Possibilities

The SAP Fiori development portal supports you in real-time exploration, and we‚Äôre eager to hear your feedback to make the portal even better. Thank you for joining us on this journey. We‚Äôre excited to see how you‚Äôll harness the full potential of SAP Fiori elements and the SAP Fiori development portal. Who knows - you might be the next speaker at our SAP Fiori development roundtables!

Stay tuned for the next post, where we‚Äôll dive deeper how you can use the SAP development portal to derive your path of rapid, flexible SAP Fiori app development.

  • Get familiar with SAP Fiori development portal and the power of the building blocks (2 of 6)
  • Explore the potential of SAP Fiori development portal using complex building blocks (3 of 6)
  • Use SAP Fiori development portal to understand extension options for standard floorplans (4 of 6)
  • Prepare building custom pages by using SAP Fiori development portal (5 of 6)
  • Bringing the SAP Fiori development portal and its use to the next level (6 of 6)

We first announced our work on the SAP Fiori development portal at UI5con 2025 in July and are now happy to report its first delivery with SAPUI5 1.141. Further enhancements are already in preparation as you read this, continuing our commitment to improving the SAP Fiori development .

After exploring the building blocks, their use in standard floorplans and custom pages, and how the SAP Fiori development portal supports your workflow, we‚Äôre now introducing its soft launch. 
The SAP Fiori development portal will for now be available only via a dedicated link for SAPUI5 version 1.141. Starting with SAPUI5 1.142 it will be directly integrated into the UI5 demo kit - no separate version or link required. Stay tuned for the updated access details with SAPUI5 1.142.

entry.title: Re: Assign Processes to Process responsibles in Signavio...
entry.content:
Hello Angeliki, 

thank you for your question. 

The best practice for assigning a responsible person or roles to your processes is to maintain these roles directly in the Dictionary (within category roles).
Within the respective process owner attribute, you can then use a Dictionary link to select from the roles or names maintained there.

This approach ensures consistency and simplifies maintenance. If a person or role changes, you only need to update it once in the Dictionary and the linked attribute will automatically reflect the update.

Best regards 

Jessica

entry.title: Re: Message and Header exchange from Child to Parent flows
entry.content:
Hi Aananda,

In the screenshot we can see that even though exception handling subprocess ends with normal message end, an error is still thrown in main process

 

In order to propagate headers back to calling process, we need to make sure that child process is in COMPLETED status.

Kind regards,

Shweta

entry.title: Re: Business Goal percentage not calculating correctly
entry.content: I don't think you need customization. The business goals should equal 100% and the section weight is 90%. If your goals add up to 90%, you will get 90% or 90%. For example, using the 90/10 scenario you laid out, the business target is $900. If you had 3 goals each achieving 100%, a 30% goal would gain $270, a 20% goal would gain $180 and a 50% goal would gain $450, equaling $900. The confusion here is although the section weight is 90%, the goals always need to add up to 100% to achieve the full 90% of the total bonus target.

entry.title: Re: Effective date compensation
entry.content: The eligibility rules are effective dated as well.   So based on the EC effective date defined in the template, the eligibility rules will be applied as they would be on that effective date.   So if you had an eligibility rule with a version effective 1/1/1900 and an update effective 1/1/2025, and the template EC effective date is 12/31/2024, the 1/1/1900 rule would apply.   If the effective date in the template was 2/1/2025, the 1/1/2025 rule would be used.   Hope this is clear.

entry.title: Re: Avoid accounting document while moving the stock from...
entry.content:
Hello @Mohammed_Abbasraja 

No, it is not and must not be possible. That would be against accounting practices.

By transferring goods customer returns (stock not owned by you) to unrestricted (stock owned by you), you increase the stock value. That has to be reflected in your FI books. Otherwise, an inconsistency between inventory management and accounting would be introduced. 

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: How to handle ‚Äúusernames‚Äù, ‚ÄúGlobal User IDs‚Äù and ‚Äúexternal IDs‚Äù in your landscape?
entry.content:
Hello  @1Gunnar @dyaryura @Colt 

In a scenario with the following architecture:
Entra ‚Üí IAS ‚Üí SAC
Users are provisioned from Entra to IAS and then further to cloud applications (e.g., SAC). 

Users are authentificated in Entra.

SAP recommends in their documentation to take the Global User ID directly from IAS and distribute it to the cloud applications. How does this work when users authenticate via Entra?

My questions are:

  1. Should the Entra Object ID be mapped to the Global User ID (if users authenticate in Entra)?
  2. What value should be used in the NameID field (e.g., in SAC for SSO)?
    • Must this always be the Global User ID?
    • Or can it also be another attribute, such as EmployeeNumber?
  3. Regarding the Subject Name Identifier in IAS:

             - Should the Primary Attribute = Corporate Identity Provider = object_id  ?

              - Schould the Fallback Attribute = Identity Diretory = "user_uuid"  ?

 

     4. How can I get the Global User ID into the NameID field in SAC?

I am unsure how to best implement these points and would appreciate any advice or best practices.

Thank you very much in advance for your support !!!

Many Thanks and Best Regards

entry.title: Interchangeability in S4 ePPDS
entry.content:
Does someone knew if it is possible to prevent the system to include the two product from the interchangeability into the same process order?

With the substitute orders the system calculate the cutover of product A & Product B. 

Normally only A or B should be in the component list of the process order, but if with valid interchangeability master data the system might include both products into the list. 

Any ideas?
